feed.title: Clashofclans - Esport News
feed.subtitle: RSS wrapper of Clashofclans inbox Esport News

entry.title: Welcome to Clash Esports!
entry.content:
Hi Chief,

Welcome to the World of Clash of Clans Esports! To help you along, we’ve gathered the most relevant information about the Clash of Clans competitive scene in this article. This will be your go to when wondering what tournaments are coming up and what is ongoing right now, but also for checking out some of the past tournament information.

This article will be frequently updated with new information so make sure you come back here to be up-to-date with what's happening!

Ongoing tournaments

Time for action! Here is a list of all Supercell supported Clash of Clans tournaments that are ongoing at the moment. Whether you're looking to play or watch, make sure to read the details below.

Clash of Clans World Championship 2024

The Clash of Clans World Championships are back for yet another year of amazing clashing! With a total of $1.000.000 on the line & 6 Golden Tickets up for grabs (4 from the monthly competitions, 1 from the Chinese Regional Qualifier and 1 from the Last Chance Qualifier), this is YOUR chance to secure a ticket to the Clash Worlds Finals!

Snapdragon Pro Series

The Snapdragon Pro Series returns for another season, and this time the competition will be even more special - you get to test your skill against players from all around the world!

With a Silver Ticket to the Clash of Clans World Championship Last Chance Qualifier and a $50,000 prize pool on the line, this is not a competition you want to miss!

  • Participation Criteria: All TH16 players of a season must be residents and physically located in one of the countries specified for their region in point 1.4 of the Rulebook. All players of a season must be 16 years of age or older by the time they participate in the series.

  • Prize Pool: $50,000

  • Rules: Read all the rules in SPS's Official Rulebook HERE!

  • Status: Signups open.

  • Follow the Snapdragon Pro Series on X (previously known as Twitter) to stay up to date with everything SPS Related!

Global Clash Cup Season 9

A brand new season of the Global Clash Cup is upon us and promises to be a heart-pounding thrill ride! From Town Hall 16 to 10, there are 10 electrifying divisions to choose from. Prepare to unleash your mastery and seize global victory, with $19,000 up for grabs for the boldest Clashers. The Gothic Division Champion will win a Silver Ticket to the World Championship Last Chance Qualifier!

  • Participation Criteria: Players must be at least 16 years of age to participate, subject to applicable laws and regulations of their country of residence. For players aged 16 to 17 (16 to 18 in South Korea and 16 to 19 in Japan), a parent or legal guardian must complete and submit the Parental/Legal Guardian Consent Form provided by GCC. 1.1.15. Players must reside in a country where Clash of Clans is available to download in the local application store and be the sole owner of the accounts used for participation in the league. Players residing in mainland China are not eligible to participate.

  • Prize Pool: $19,000

  • Rules: Read all the rules in GCC's Official Rulebook HERE!

  • Signups: Open, sign up HERE!

  • Status: Signups open.

  • Follow GCC on X (previously known as Twitter) to stay up to date with everything Global Clash Cup Related!

Clash Champs' Trophy Race

Organized by Clash Champs, the Trophy Race is a Tournament where the player that gets the most amount of trophies in a given time wins! Starting with Town Hall 9, the trophy race will feature an edition for each Town Hall level up to TH16!

Participation Criteria: All Players that reside in a country where Clash of Clans is available to download in the local app store are eligible to participate.

  • Prize Pool: Gems, Champs Bucks & Clash of Clans Merchandise.

  • Rules: Read all the rules in Clash Champs' Trophy Race official Rulebook!

  • Signups: Open, sign up HERE!

  • Status: Signups open.

  • Follow Clash Champs on X (previously known as Twitter) to stay up to date with everything Trophy Race related!

Past tournaments

Below you’ll find some of the past tournaments where Clash players have battled for World Championship titles, prize money and glory. Check out some of the best plays and strategies from the best in the world and learn a trick or two!

Clash of Clans World Championship 2023

The Clash of Clans World Championships was back for yet another year of amazing clashing! With a total of $1.150.000 on the line & 8 Golden Tickets up for grabs (4 from community-organised tournaments & 4 from the official Championship Qualifier), this was the chance to secure a ticket to the Clash Worlds Finals that were held in Helsinki, Finland from the 24th to the 26th of November!

In order to participate, players needed to be at least 16 years old and have the highest Town Hall level.

  • The World Championship was free to play. Players were not required to pay anything to register and/or play.

  • Status: Finished

  • Winner: Clash Champs

  • Rewatch the entire competition here, or if you prefer to skip ahead to the main event, check out each day's stream below:

    • Day 1

    • Day 2

    • Day 3

Worlds Warmup 2024

The Clash of Clans Worlds Warmup was back in 2024! Featuring Town Hall 16 and a $30,000 USD prize pool it was BOUND to re-ignite the #ClashEsports scene!

To warm up for the 2024 Clash Worlds Championship season, this tournament's format started with 2 Open Qualifiers where 13 qualified teams (top teams from each Open Qualifier) advanced to the Group Stage where 3 Finalist teams from the 2023 World Championship joined them. The top 2 teams of each Group advanced for a face-off in the Playoffs.  Participation Criteria: All Players had to be at least +16years old and reside in a country where Clash of Clans was available to download in the local app store.

  • Prize Pool: $30,000

  • Rules: Worlds Warmup Rulebook HERE!

  • Signups: Closed

  • Status: Finished

  • Winner: Synchronic

We are always looking for more people to collaborate with and are eager to help our community grow! So if you want to explore running a tournament, start by checking out our Community Tournament Guidelines and reach out to us by email at tournaments@supercell.com!

Clash On!

- The Clash of Clans Team

Apple is not a sponsor of, or responsible for conducting, the promotions or events.

entry.title: Clash Worlds - All you need to know!
entry.content:
Hi, Chief!

It’s that time of the year again! With the start of the 2024 Clash of Clans World Championship right around the corner, it’s time we break-down everything YOU need to know about how to claim your spot at the top, and become a World Champion!

Let’s start from the basics! We are going to back our roots, bringing back Monthly Competitions with a couple changes from the 2023 format - The 2024 World Championship will consist of the following:

  • Four Monthly Competitions

  • One Chinese Regional Qualifier

  • One Last Chance Qualifier

  • And an in-person World Championship Final

MONTHLY COMPETITIONS

Let’s take a look at how each Monthly Competition works! Each Monthly Competition has three phases:

  • The Open Qualifiers (Phase 1)

  • The Monthly Qualifiers (Phase 2)

  • The Monthly Finals (Phase 3)

The Open Qualifiers are a 6-day ladder competition hosted through the in-game Tournament Hub. The top 128 teams from the Open Qualifiers will advance to the Monthly Qualifiers: A double elimination bracket that will be played until only 6 teams remain. These 6 teams will move forward to the Monthly Finals: Similar to the Monthly Qualifiers, the Monthly Finals will also be a double elimination bracket, where the original 6 teams will battle it out until one team comes out on top and wins the Golden Ticket. In addition, the runner-up in every Monthly Finals will receive a Silver Ticket, guaranteeing them a spot to compete in the Last Chance Qualifier - so don’t fret if you don’t receive a Golden Ticket!

The Last Chance Qualifier will consist of the four teams who earned a Silver Ticket in the four Monthly Competitions, in addition to the teams who earned a Silver Ticket in this year’s Community Tournaments. This will be an epic showdown to confirm the final team that will be participating in the 2024 World Championship Final!

DON’T FORGET! In order to participate in the Monthly Competitions, make sure to sign up during the registration period! Registration for each Monthly Competition runs for 6 days, so don’t miss your chance to get in on the action!

Check out the full schedule below, or visit our World Championship 2024 Schedule for more information! Mark these dates in your calendar so you don’t miss a single chance to qualify!

April Monthly Qualifier dates:

  • Registrations - March 26th to 31st

  • Phase 1 - April 1st to 6th

  • Monthly Qualifier - April 13th & 14th

  • Monthly Finals - April 20th & 21st

May Monthly Qualifier dates:

  • Registrations - April 27th to 30th

  • Phase 1 - May 1st to 6th

  • Monthly Qualifier - May 18th & 19th

  • Monthly Finals - May 25th & 26th

June Monthly Qualifier dates:

  • Registrations - May 28th to 31st

  • Phase 1 - June 1st to 6th

  • Monthly Qualifier - June 15th & 16th

  • Monthly Finals - June 22nd & 23rd

July Monthly Qualifier dates:

  • Registrations- June 27th to 30th

  • Phase 1 - July 1st to 6th

  • Monthly Qualifier - July 13th & 14th

  • Monthly Finals - July 20th & 21st

Last Chance Qualifier dates:

  • September 7th & 8th

World Finals dates:

  • November 2024

Now, let’s not forget about the whopping $1.000.000 Prize Pool reserved for the 2024 World Championship! While the details of Prize Pool distribution for the Last Chance Qualifier and World Finals is being prepared, take a look at the Monthly Finals Prize Pool, outlined above. Each month there’s a total of $50,000 prize pool up for grabs for the top 6 teams!

You’re not going to want to miss any Clash Esports action this year, and we’ve got multiple ways for you to tune in. Make sure to subscribe to the Clans of Clans YouTube, Twitch, Facebook & TikTok official channels, and turn notifications on, to not miss a single second!

That’s it, Chief! If you have any doubts or need assistance, check out the Official Rulebook! If your questions are still not answered, please reach out to clashofclans_admin@ee.gg to have all your questions about the World Championship answered! Please note that tournament administrators cannot assist with inquiries not related to the tournament, such as in-app purchases or account issues.

Stay tuned to the Clash of Clans in-game Esports tab, Clash of Clans Esports X, Instagram & Esports website to make sure you’re up-to-date on everything #ClashWorlds related!

Clash On!

- The Clash of Clans Esports Team

entry.title: Rewatch the April Monthly Qualifier Day 1!
Rewatch the April Monthly Qualifier Day 2!
April Monthly Finals - All you need to know!
entry.content:
Hi, Chief!

With the April Monthly Qualifier complete, the next step in your journey is the April Monthly Finals - and oh boy, it’s going to be a good one!

The April Monthly Finals will be hosted across two days, April 20 - 21. Both days will start at 14:00 UTC, so make sure to put that in your calendar! Now, let’s get into it…

Let’s start off with the essential details! From the April Monthly Qualifier, 6 teams secured their spot in the April Monthly Finals - 2 in the Upper Bracket and 4 in the Lower Bracket. Seeding for the April Monthly Finals will be determined by each team’s placement in the April Monthly Qualifier - the 4 teams advancing from the Lower Bracket will start in Round 1 of the Upper Bracket, while the 2 teams advancing from the Upper Bracket will receive a bye in Round 1, and play their first match in Round 2. The higher the seed, the greater the advantage!

The 6 teams will face off in a two-day double-elimination tournament, hosted through the in-app Tournament Hub until 1 team will ultimately be crowned the April Monthly Finals Champion and secure their Golden Ticket. But that’s not all! The runner-up will receive a Silver Ticket and a spot in the Last Chance Qualifier! The first two Upper Bracket Rounds and the first Lower Bracket Round will be played on Day 1 (April 20), while all remaining Rounds and matches will be played on Day 2 (April 21).

Now, let’s take a closer look at the 6 teams that will be competing in the April Monthly Finals…

As mentioned, 6 teams will be competing in the April Monthly Finals - and let me tell you, they’re going to knock your troops off!

The 6 teams joining the April Monthly Finals are as follows, listed by their seed… NAVI: NAVI consists of GAKU, Kazuma, Klaus, STARs and pCastro. Check out the team on Twitter! Millesime MG: Millesime MG consists of Natchoa, KingsMan, Hawk, TryHard and El Teemper. Check out the team on Twitter!

Free Agents: Free Agents consists of CELINHO, LoOPe, Pato, Bernaul and Leo. Check out the team on Twitter!

Synchronic Gaming: Synchronic Gaming consists of Einstein, Philipp, General X, Marc and Simon. Check out the team on Twitter!

VM Surgical: VM Surgical consists of Sami, Krzysztof, Ultra, Isma and Simon. Check out the team on Twitter!

Vatang: Vatang consists of Invincible LG, DP, Dream Walker, KIIIBEROS and LansLota. Check out the team on Twitter!

NAVI and Millesime MG will receive a bye in Upper Bracket Round 1, immediately starting their run in Upper Bracket Round 2, while Free Agents, Synchronic Gaming, VM Surgical and Vatang will battle it out in Upper Bracket Round 1. Now that we’ve talked about the teams and players, let’s show some love to our Talent and Community Casters!

We’ve got a star-studded cast for the April Monthly Finals! 

First, we have our official #ClashWorlds talent, who you will see on the English broadcasts…

CarbonFin

iTzu

Clash with Eric

But that isn’t all! There will also be a stellar cast of Community Casters covering a variety of languages for our fans all across the world…

ES: Zolokotroko, Style, Sockers and shioN

PT: RAFACOC, Marinaul and Bruna7cr

FR: Skarex COC, Optimus Prime

DE: Noobs iMTV

IT: Haplo80, Medda87

KR: FADA, JAEJINCOC

JP: yuta14

ID: Chief Rian Gaming

ZHTC: 烏龜 Turtle

It’s about time we start talking about the $$$...

Did somebody say… Prize Pool?!? You heard that right - there will be a whopping $50,000 up for grabs in the April Monthly Final for the 6 participants. See the breakdown of Prize Pool distribution in the graphic above!

You’re not going to want to miss the FIRST Monthly Finals of the 2024 #ClashWorlds year. You’re probably wondering, “But Chief, where can I watch the first showdown of my favorite Clash of Clans esports players?” LOOK NO FURTHER, because there are multiple ways to watch…

Our go-to location for watching the April Monthly Finals is the Clash of Clans Event Site. On the event site, you’ll be able to watch the stream in 8 languages: English, Spanish, Portuguese, French, German, Italian, Korean, and Japanese! In addition, by signing in with your Supercell ID, you’ll be able to earn in-game rewards - that’s right, you’ll earn rewards just by watching! Check out the full list of Event Sites below…

English German French Italian Spanish Portuguese Japanese Korean

That’s it, Chief! Mark your calendars and stay tuned to the Clash of Clans in-game Esports tab, Clash of Clans Esports X, Instagram & Esports website to make sure you’re up-to-date on everything #ClashWorlds related!

Clash On!

- The Clash of Clans Esports Team

entry.title: Rewatch Day 1 of the April Monthly Finals!
Rewatch Day 2 of the April Monthly Finals!
Congrats, Synchronic!
entry.content:
Congrats to the April Monthly Finals Champions - Synchronic!

Hi, Chief!

After the intense Open Qualifier, followed by the epic Monthly Qualifier, culminating in the first Monthly Finals... The first 2024 Clash of Clans World Championship Finalist team is decided!

After an AMAZING Lower Bracket run forcing NAVI to a Grand Finals reset, Synchronic has claimed the April Monthly Finals Golden Ticket and the biggest share of the $50,000 prize pool!

Congratulations to General X, Simon, Marc, Philipp & Einstein!

Rewatch the epic two-day showdown of Synchronic's road to glory, securing their Golden Ticket and their spot at the Clash of Clans World Championship Finals!

📺 [EMBEDDED VIDEO] 📺 [EMBEDDED VIDEO]

There are still 5 more Golden Tickets up for grabs in the upcoming Monthly Finals and Last Chance Qualifier - make sure to sign up in the Tournament Hub for YOUR chance at making it to the World Finals! Stay tuned to the Clash of Clans in-game Esports tab, Clash of Clans Esports X, Instagram & Esports website to make sure you're up-to-date on everything #ClashWorlds related!

Clash on!

- The Clash of Clans Esports Team

entry.title: The Global Clash Cup is back!
entry.content:
Hi Chief,

The ultimate battle for immortality is coming! A brand new season of Global Clash Cup is upon us and promises to be a heart-pounding thrill ride. 

From Town Hall 16 to 10, there are 10 electrifying divisions to choose from. Prepare to unleash your mastery and seize global victory, with $19,000 up for grabs for the boldest Clashers. The Gothic Division Champion will win a Silver Ticket to the World Championship Last Chance Qualifier! 

This is an opportunity to gain glory and engrave your name into the GCC history books. Join the GCC Discord server to apply! Applications open on Monday, May 6th at 12:00 UTC and close on Monday, May 27th at 12:00 UTC. 

Mark the key dates in your calendars! 

Divisions

Make your pick from 10 divisions. There is a division for every team!

Prize Pool

A staggering CASH PRIZE of $19,000 and MVP awards including Gold Passes, Sceneries and Hero Skins make up the prize pool. Check out the cash prize distribution below. 

Format

The season kicks off with the Qualifiers where teams strive to finish top of the pack. The top teams on the leaderboard at the end of the Qualifiers will advance to the Playoffs. The Playoffs will be in a single elimination format where teams are eliminated after one loss. 

The Grand Finale in the Eclectic, Baroque, Doric and Modern Divisions will be a best-of-2 match. In the Gothic Division, the top 8 teams from the Playoffs will advance to the Finals. The Finals is a 2-day double elimination event where teams are eliminated after two losses. 

Ready your team and apply NOW HERE! The battleground awaits your arrival. 

Read the Esports Divisions Rulebook and Established Divisions Rulebook for more information regarding Global Clash Cup Season 9! 

Do not miss out on any of the action! Visit the Global Clash Cup website and follow Global Clash Cup on X, Twitch and YouTube.

Clash on!

entry.title: Rewatch the May Monthly Qualifier Day 1!
Rewatch the May Monthly Qualifier Day 2!
2024 May Monthly Finals - All You Need To Know!
entry.content:
Hi, Chief!

The Clash of Clans World Championship is back and better than ever after an amazing April Monthly Competition - The May Monthly Finals is right around the corner! But before we dive into all you need to know about the upcoming Monthly Finals, let’s give another congratulations to the April Monthly Finals Champions, and the team that secured the first Golden Ticket of the #ClashWorlds 2024 year - Synchronic! With an amazing Lower Bracket Run culminating in a nail-biting Grand Finals against NAVI, Synchronic delivered two PERFECT Wars in the Grand Finals and the Grand Finals Reset to set the stage for the rest of the year! Rewatch Day 1 and Day 2 of the April Monthly Finals to catch up on the first Monthly Competition of #ClashWorlds 2024 before this weekend!

It’s time to dive into what YOU need to know for the upcoming May Monthly Finals!

The May Monthly Finals will be hosted across two days, on May 25 - 26. Both days will start at 14:00 UTC, so make sure to put that in your calendar! Now, let’s take a look at the starting bracket…

Tournament Format

So, let’s take a closer look at how we got here! The May Monthly Competition began with the Open Qualifier, where ANY team that signed up during the May registration period battled it out on Ladder until we found the Top 128 teams that competed in the May Monthly Qualifier. Over the course of the two-day Monthly Qualifier, the 128 teams clashed until only 6 teams remained - these 6 teams secured their spot in the May Monthly Finals!

Seeding for the May Monthly Finals is determined by each of the 6 team’s placement in the May Monthly Qualifier - the 2 highest-seeded teams will start in Round 2 of the Upper Bracket, while Seeds 3 - 6 will start in Round 1 of the Upper Bracket. Yes, that’s right! Placement in the Monthly Qualifiers is crucial for Monthly Finals seeding - the two highest-seeded teams will receive a bye in the first Round, and start one step closer to winning a Golden Ticket! The first two Upper Bracket Rounds and the first Lower Bracket Round will be played on Day 1 of the May Monthly Finals (May 25), while all remaining Rounds and Wars will be played on Day 2 of the May Monthly Finals (May 26).

Now, let’s take a closer look at the 6 teams that will be competing in the May Monthly Finals this weekend…

Participating Teams

6 teams will be participating in the May Monthly Finals! Millesime MG and SAVAGE ELITE (previously known as Free Agents) are returning from the April Monthly Finals, but we’ll also have 4 new teams!

The 6 teams participating in the May Monthly Finals are as follows, listed by their seed…

Early Attax: Early Attax consists of Imraan, Leo, Aquiles, komakun & Yatta

VM Legacy: VM Legacy consists of Darkstar, Fluxxy, Synthe, Max & Ninj

SAVAGE ELITE: SAVAGE ELITE consists of Bernaul NTC, LoOPe, Pato, Leo & Celinho

Dizi E-Sports: Dizi E-Sports consists of Chien, Denden, JaGa, KAI & YueTa

Millesime MG: Millesime MG consists of Natchoa, Hawk, 0815Teemper, TryHard & KingsMan

HTM Esports: HTM Esports consists of MOHAMAD MARRAWI, agent33, Nick, Ghost & Rigotorres23

Early Attax and VM Legacy will receive a bye in Upper Bracket Round 1, immediately starting their run in Upper Bracket Round 2, while SAVAGE ELITE, Dizi E-Sports, Millesime MG, and HTM Esports will battle it out in Upper Bracket Round 1. You might be asking, “What about the broadcast talent and my favorite Community Casters?!?” - Let’s get into it!

Official Talent & Community Casters

We’ve got a star-studded cast for the May Monthly Finals broadcast and Community Streams! 

First, we have our official #ClashWorlds talent, who you will see on the English broadcasts. As you may have noticed, CarbonFin, iTzu and Clash with Eric are returning from the April Monthly Finals - but we’ll also have a new edition for May - Woody!

CarbonFin

iTzu

Clash With Eric

Woody

Community Casters will also be returning for the May Monthly Finals! See below for the full list of Community Casters, the languages they will be streaming in, and the links to their channels where you can watch!

Spanish: Style, SOCKERS, Zolokotroko, shioN

Portuguese: Bruna7Cr, Marinaul, Rafa COC, Decow

French: Skarex, Optimus Prime COC

German: Noobs iMTV

Italian: Haplo80, Medda87

Korean: FADA, JAEJINCOC

Japanese: yuta14

Indonesian: BangSkot, Chief Rian Gaming

Chinese: Turtle

Let’s not forget about the $$$...

Prize Pool

Did somebody say… Prize Pool?!? You heard that right - there will be a whopping $50.000 up for grabs in the May Monthly Finals for the 6 participants. See the breakdown of Prize Pool distribution in the graphic above!

Where to Watch

Listen up, Chief - the BEST location to enjoy the May Monthly Finals this weekend is the Clash of Clans Event Site. On the event site, you’ll be able to watch the stream in a total of 8 different languages: English, Spanish, Portuguese, French, German, Italian, Korean, and Japanese!

English German French Italian Spanish Portuguese Japanese Korean

BUT THAT’S NOT ALL! What’s better than watching the best Clash of Clans esports? Earning rewards, of course! By signing in with your Supercell ID on the Clash of Clans Event Site, you can earn in-game rewards just by watching! Check out the full suite of Event Site rewards above and bookmark your language’s Event Site to remember the BEST place to tune in!

That’s it, Chief! Mark your calendars and stay tuned to the Clash of Clans in-game Esports tab, Clash of Clans Esports X, Instagram & Esports website to make sure you’re up-to-date on everything #ClashWorlds related!

Clash On!

- The Clash of Clans Esports Team

entry.title: Rewatch Day 1 of the May Monthly Finals!
Rewatch Day 2 of the May Monthly Finals!
Congratulations, VM Legacy!
entry.content:
Congratulations to the May Monthly Finals Champions - VM Legacy!

Hi, Chief!

The May Monthly Competition has officially come to an end - over the past month, the amazing Clash of Clans teams competed in the May Open Qualifiers, followed by the May Monthly Qualifiers, culminating in the second Monthly Finals of #ClashWorlds 2024…

The Clash of Clans World Championship May Monthly Finals Golden Ticket winner is decided!

VM Legacy was simply unstoppable in the May Monthly Finals - securing ONLY perfect Wars throughout their Championship run. VM Legacy has claimed the May Monthly Finals Golden Ticket and the biggest share of the $50,000 prize pool!

Congratulations to Darkstar, Synthe, Max, Ninj & Fluxxy!

Don’t forget about the May Monthly Finals Silver Ticket winner!

Congratulations to SAVAGE ELITE for winning the May Monthly Finals Silver Ticket! SAVAGE ELITE has secured their entry into the Last Chance Qualifier and another chance to take home a Golden Ticket and a spot at the Clash of Clans World Championship Finals!

Congratulations to Celinho, Pato, Leo, LoOPe & Bernaul!

Rewatch the epic two-day showdown of VM Legacy's road to the Golden Ticket, securing their spot at the Clash of Clans World Championship Finals!

📺 [EMBEDDED VIDEO] 📺 [EMBEDDED VIDEO]

And just like that, the first two Golden Tickets of #ClashWorlds 2024 have been awarded - but that’s not all! There are still 4 more Golden Tickets up for grabs in the upcoming Monthly Finals and Last Chance Qualifier - make sure to sign-up in the Tournament Hub for YOUR chance at making it to the Clash of Clans World Championship Finals! Stay tuned to the Clash of Clans in-game Esports tab, Clash of Clans Esports X, Instagram & Esports website to make sure you're up-to-date on everything #ClashWorlds related!

Clash On!

- The Clash of Clans Esports Team

entry.title: Rewatch the June Monthly Qualifier Day 1!
Rewatch the June Monthly Qualifier Day 2!
2024 June Monthly Finals - All You Need To Know!
entry.content:
Hi, Chief!

What a way to start the #ClashWorlds 2024 year! Two Golden Tickets and two Silver Tickets have already been secured during the April & May Monthly Finals - Synchronic and Vatang taking the Golden and Silver Tickets in April, respectively, with VM Legacy and SAVAGE ELITE taking the Golden and Silver Tickets in May, respectively! The next Golden and Silver Tickets for the June Monthly Finals will be awarded this weekend! Before diving into what you need to know for the upcoming June Monthly Finals, get caught up to speed with the journey so far - Rewatch Day 1 and Day 2 of the April Monthly Finals, as well as Day 1 and Day 2 of the May Monthly Finals before seeing June’s top 6 teams clash it out this Saturday & Sunday, June 22 & 23.

It’s time to dive into what YOU need to know for the upcoming June Monthly Finals!

The June Monthly Finals will be hosted across two days, on June 22 - 23. Both days will start at 14:00 UTC, so make sure to put that in your calendar! Now, let’s take a look at the starting bracket…

TOURNAMENT FORMAT

Let’s take a closer look at June Monthly Competition so far! 128 teams came out of the Open Qualifier to compete in the June Monthly Qualifier. After two hectic days of clashing in the June Monthly Qualifier, 6 teams reigned above all others - these 6 teams secured their spot in the June Monthly finals this weekend!

Seeding for the June Monthly Finals is determined by each of the 6 team’s placement in the June Monthly Qualifiers - the 2 highest-seeded teams will start in Round 2 of the Upper Bracket, while Seeds 3 - 6 will start in Round 1 of the Upper Bracket. Yes, that’s right! Placement in the Monthly Qualifiers is crucial for Monthly Finals seeding - the two highest-seeded teams will receive a bye in the first Round, and start one step closer to winning a Golden Ticket! The first two Upper Bracket Rounds and the first Lower Bracket Round will be played on Day 1 of the June Monthly Finals (June 22), while all remaining Rounds and Wars will be played on Day 2 of the June Monthly Finals (June 23).

Now, let’s take a closer look at the 6 teams that will be competing in the June Monthly Finals this weekend…

PARTICIPATING TEAMS

6 teams will be participating in the June Monthly Finals! They are as follows, listed by their seed…

Millesime MG consists of KingsMan, 0815Teemper, TryHard, Natchoa & Hawk

Tribe Gaming consists of Cronos, Jojo23, Riqirez, Excosist & Nebrax

Vista Ridge consists of SORA, PEKKACHU, ERIK, Manik & Elektro

Dizi X Cenizos consists of Xiao Tian, Nelson, M0min, Alxlc, Melie

Pulse Gaming consists of NYU, sahara, Chihawa, Lincoln & Wado

MO Shifters consists of Ahmad, Zkin, Sean, Leo & Imraan

Millesime MG and Tribe Gaming will receive a bye in Upper Bracket Round 1, immediately starting their run in Upper Bracket Round 2, while Vista Ridge, Dizi X Cenizos, Pulse Gaming and MO Shifters will battle it out in Upper Bracket Round 1. Let’s get into the casting talent!

OFFICIAL TALENT & COMMUNITY CASTERS

We’ve got a star-studded cast for the June Monthly Finals broadcast and Community Streams! 

First, we have our official #ClashWorlds talent, who you will see on the English broadcasts - CarbonFin, iTzu, Clash Bashing & Woody!

CarbonFin

iTzu

Clash Bashing

Woody

Community Casters will also be returning for the June Monthly Finals! See below for the full list of Community Casters, the languages they will be streaming in, and the links to their channels where you can watch!

Spanish: Style, SOCKERS, Zolokotroko, shioN, Srta Maverick

Portuguese: Bruna7Cr, Marinaul, Rafa COC, Decow

French: Skarex, Optimus Prime COC

Italian: Haplo80, Medda87

German: Noobs iMTV

Japanese: yuta14

Korean: FADA

Indonesian: BangSkot, Chief Rian Gaming

Traditional Chinese: Turtle

Vietnamese: Akari Gaming

Hindi: R S Clash

Let’s not forget about the $$$...

PRIZE POOL

Take a look at the graphic above to see the breakdown of how the 6 participating teams will clash it out for their share of the $50,000 June Monthly Finals prize pool!

WHERE TO WATCH

Look no further - the Clash of Clans Event Site is the best location to watch the June Monthly Finals, make predictions, and earn in-game rewards! Think you know which teams have the best shot at the June Monthly Finals Golden Ticket? Want to earn rewards by answering #ClashWorlds trivia AND just by watching your favorite teams clash? The Event Site has it all! 

Sign in with your Supercell ID on the Clash of Clans Event Site to get access to all the rewards you see in the graphic below!

The Clash of Clans Event Site has 8 language options you can choose from: English, Spanish, Portuguese, French, German, Italian, Korean & Japanese!

English

Spanish

Portuguese

French

German

Italian

Korean

Japanese

That’s it, Chief! Mark your calendars and stay tuned to the Clash of Clans in-game Esports tab, Clash of Clans Esports X, Instagram & Esports website to make sure you’re up-to-date on everything #ClashWorlds related!

Clash On!

- The Clash of Clans Esports Team

entry.title: Rewatch Day 1 of the June Monthly Finals!
Rewatch Day 2 of the June Monthly Finals!
Congratulations, Millesime MG!
entry.content:
Congratulations to the June Monthly Finals Champions - Millesime MG!

Hi, Chief!

And just like that - 3 Golden Tickets have been awarded and the June Monthly Competition has concluded! In the past month, the top Clash of Clans teams and players have clashed in the June Open Qualifiers, the June Monthly Qualifiers and ultimately one final time in this month’s #ClashWorlds June Monthly Finals…

The Clash of Clans World Championship June Monthly Finals Golden Ticket winner is decided!

This is the third time in #ClashWorlds 2024 that Millesime MG has participated in a Monthly Finals - and you know what they say, third time's the charm! Millesime MG claim the #ClashWorlds June Monthly Finals Golden ticket on the back of a FLAWLESS Monthly Finals run, winning every single War! They will take home the biggest share of the $50,000 prize pool and have earned their spot at the Clash of Clans World Championship Finals!

Congratulations to KingsMan, 0815Teemper, TryHard, Natchoa & Hawk!

Don’t forget about the June Monthly Finals Silver Ticket winner!

Congratulations to MO Shifters for winning the June Monthly Finals Silver Ticket! MO Shifters will participate in the Last Chance Qualifier for another chance at a Golden Ticket and a spot at the Clash of Clans World Championship Finals!

Show some love to the 5 June Monthly Finals Silver Ticket Winners!

Ahmad, Zkin, Sean, Leo & Imraan

Rewatch the epic two-day showdown of Millesime MG's road to the Golden Ticket, securing their spot at the Clash of Clans World Championship Finals!

📺 [EMBEDDED VIDEO] 📺 [EMBEDDED VIDEO]

Three teams have now stamped their names into the 2024 #ClashWorlds record books and have claimed Golden Tickets. However, there are still 3 Golden Tickets up for grabs in the July Monthly Finals, the Chinese Regional Qualifier and the Last Chance Qualifier! Don’t forget to sign-up in the Tournament Hub for YOUR chance at cementing your place at the top and making it to the Clash of Clans World Championship Finals! Stay tuned to the Clash of Clans in-game Esports tab, Clash of Clans Esports X, Instagram & Esports website to make sure you're up-to-date on everything #ClashWorlds related!

Clash On!

- The Clash of Clans Esports Team

entry.title: The Snapdragon Pro Series is BACK!
entry.content:
The Snapdragon Pro Series is Back!

Hi Chief,

The Snapdragon Pro Series returns for another season, and this time the competition will be even more special - you get to test your skill against players from all around the world!

With a Silver Ticket to the Clash of Clans World Championship Last Chance Qualifier and a $50,000 prize pool on the line, this is not a competition you want to miss! Sign up NOW on FACEIT HERE!

The Snapdragon Mobile Open phase consists of 4 cups played over two days each - all in best of 1 Single Elimination bracket. The first day will reveal the top 8 teams who will advance to the second day.

Four cup winners will qualify for the Split Finals. The remaining 4 slots in the finals will be seeded based on the overall Leaderboard.

Next, the Snapdragon Mobile Open Finals a two-day, double-elimination tournament for the best will determine the winner, who will take home the Silver Ticket to the LCQ and the biggest share of the $50.000 prize pool!

Save the dates in your calendar to make sure you don't miss a single minute of the competition!

Now that you know the basics make sure watch the tutorial video below and follow the instructions to sign up!

  • Register a FACEIT account (All players of the team must register an account)

  • Connect your Supercell ID account to FACEIT.

  • Choose the tournament you want to participate in and click submit application.

  • In the application text box, write something similar to “I’d like to join, my name is [INSERT PLAYERNAME] on the team [INSERT TEAM NAME].”

  • Once approved, you will see you’re invited and need to click an orange button to join the tournament.

  • To create your team, follow the prompts in the left-hand window to invite your teammates to your team!

If you need help signing up make sure to join SPS's discord server and send a message on #coc-support!

📺 [EMBEDDED VIDEO]

That's all for now! Make sure to follow Clash of Clans Esports X, Instagram & Esports website to stay up-to-date with everything #ClashEsports related!

Clash ON!
